body:
I can activate `py-flake8`:

```
[hartzelg@rpbuchop001 spack-20161212]$ spack activate py-flake8
==> Activated extension py-configparser@3.5.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-2vyc36s for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Activated extension py-enum34@1.1.6%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-a5hkmca for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Activated extension py-mccabe@0.5.2%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-eyrwg56 for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Activated extension py-pycodestyle@2.0.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5c257kg for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Activated extension py-pyflakes@1.2.3%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-jx725az for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Activated extension py-flake8@3.0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5wabxrq for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
```

but having done so, this doesn't work:

```
[hartzelg@rpbuchop001 spack-20161212]$ spack deactivate py-flake8
==> Deactivated extension py-flake8@3.0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5wabxrq for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
```

I can use the `-a` flag:

```
[hartzelg@rpbuchop001 spack-20161212]$ spack deactivate -a py-flake8
==> Deactivating py-flake8@3.0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5wabxrq and all dependencies.
==> Deactivated extension py-flake8@3.0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5wabxrq for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Deactivated extension py-configparser@3.5.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-2vyc36s for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Deactivated extension py-enum34@1.1.6%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-a5hkmca for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Deactivated extension py-mccabe@0.5.2%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-eyrwg56 for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Deactivated extension py-pycodestyle@2.0.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5c257kg for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
==> Deactivated extension py-pyflakes@1.2.3%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-jx725az for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
```

but that leaves me with two nagging doubts:

- why is `activate` automagically recursive but `deactivate` is not; and
- is `deactivate -a` smart enough to not deactivate something that is also a dependency for a different top-level package (e.g. above, what would happen if another package also needed `py-enum34` activated?)?  At first glance it does not appear to be:

    ```
    [hartzelg@rpbuchop001 spack-20161212]$ spack activate py-enum34
    ==> Activated extension py-enum34@1.1.6%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-a5hkmca for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    [hartzelg@rpbuchop001 spack-20161212]$ spack activate py-flake8
    ==> Activated extension py-configparser@3.5.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-2vyc36s for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Activated extension py-mccabe@0.5.2%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-eyrwg56 for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Activated extension py-pycodestyle@2.0.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5c257kg for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Activated extension py-pyflakes@1.2.3%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-jx725az for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Activated extension py-flake8@3.0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5wabxrq for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    [hartzelg@rpbuchop001 spack-20161212]$ spack deactivate -a py-flake8
    ==> Deactivating py-flake8@3.0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5wabxrq and all dependencies.
    ==> Deactivated extension py-flake8@3.0.4%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5wabxrq for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Deactivated extension py-configparser@3.5.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-2vyc36s for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Deactivated extension py-enum34@1.1.6%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-a5hkmca for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Deactivated extension py-mccabe@0.5.2%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-eyrwg56 for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Deactivated extension py-pycodestyle@2.0.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-5c257kg for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    ==> Deactivated extension py-pyflakes@1.2.3%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64-jx725az for python@2.7.12~tk~ucs4%gcc@5.4.0
    [hartzelg@rpbuchop001 spack-20161212]$
    ```

How do people use `activate` in The Real World(tm)?
title: `spack activate` is not easily reversible.
